info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:15PM CDT until July 02 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL WILLIAMSON COUNTY... At 114 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Marion, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Spotters reported 50 to 70 mph wind as the storm moved south of Marion. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Marion, Carterville, Johnston City, Crainville, Energy, Pittsburg, Lake Of Egypt Area, Whiteash, Williamson County Regional Airport and Spillertown. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 44 and 58. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
